subject: RE: [junit] Announce: JDepend 1.4
msgSnippet: Unfortunately I m not the best one to estimate this - I don t use VAJ. I believe it involves writing a VAJ plug-in adapter that simply invokes one of the
messageBody:
Unfortunately I'm not the best one to estimate this - I don't use VAJ.
I believe it involves writing a VAJ plug-in adapter that simply invokes
one of the existing JDepend user interface classes which in essence
allows JDepend to be launched from a VAJ menu.

Mike

--- Michael Silverstein <msilverstein@...> wrote:
> Can you give a brief list or estimation of what needs to be changed
> for VA
> Java? That would make it easier to decide one's time/inclination.
>
> ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> Mike Silverstein
> SilverMark, Inc.
> The object testing company
> http://www.silvermark.com
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
> > Sent: Monday, July 23, 2001 9:52 AM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [junit] Announce: JDepend 1.4
> >
> >
> > There was a VAJ user who had a pretty solid start on VAJ
> integration,
> > but I think this effort may have stalled out. If anyone has the
> time
> > and inclination to provide the nuts and bolts for VAJ integration,
> I'd
> > certainly be willing to make it available from the JDepend site
> with
> > due credit.
> >
> > Mike
> >
> > --- Jason Rogers <jason.rogers@...> wrote:
> > > Great looking stuff. Any plans to make it work with VAJ?
> > >
> > > -Jason
> > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
> > > > Sent: Friday, July 20, 2001 6:18 PM
> > > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > > Subject: [junit] Announce: JDepend 1.4
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > JDepend 1.4, the freely-available Java package dependency
> > > > analyzer, has
> > > > been released. Of particular interest to JUnit users is
> > > > the ability to
> > > > write tests that automatically check metrics tolerances,
> > > > existence of
> > > > package dependency cycles, and package dependency
> constraints.
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > New Features:
> > > >
> > > > - Added package dependency constraints to support writing
> > > > tests that
> > > > fail if any package dependency other than those declared in
> the
> > > > dependency constraints are detected. Refer to the
> > > > documentation or the
> > > > jdepend.framework.ConstraintTest class for complete
> examples.
> > > >
> > > > For example, the following test case method will fail
> > > > if the analyzed
> > > > packages contain any dependencies other than those declared
> in
> > > the
> > > > dependency constraint:
> > > >
> > > > public void testDependencyConstraint() {
> > > >
> > > > JavaPackage ejb = new JavaPackage("com.xyz.ejb");
> > > > JavaPackage web = new JavaPackage("com.xyz.web");
> > > > JavaPackage util = new JavaPackage("com.xyz.util");
> > > >
> > > > ejb.dependsUpon(util);
> > > > web.dependsUpon(util);
> > > >
> > > > DependencyConstraint constraint = new
> > > > DependencyConstraint();
> > > > constraint.addPackage(ejb);
> > > > constraint.addPackage(web);
> > > > constraint.addPackage(util);
> > > >
> > > > _jdepend.analyze();
> > > >
> > > > assert(_jdepend.dependencyMatch(constraint));
> > > > }
> > > >
> > > > - Added the jdepend.xmlui.JDepend class to generate
> > > > package metrics,
> > > > dependencies, and cycles in an XML format for easier
> > > > integration with
> > > > other tools.
> > > >
> > > > Example usage:
> > > > java jdepend.xmlui.JDepend -file report.xml
> > > /myproject/src
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > The JDepend documentation is available at
> > > >
> > > > http://www.clarkware.com/software/JDepend.html
> > > >
> > > > JDepend 1.4 can be downloaded directly from
> > > >
> > > > http://www.clarkware.com/software/jdepend1.4.zip
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Any feedback you may have is most welcome and appreciated.
> > > >
> > > > Thanks and enjoy!
> > > >
> > > > Mike
> > > >
> > > > --
> > > > Mike Clark
> > > > Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
